title: 5,200 holes carved into a Peruvian mountain left by an ancient economy
description: For nearly a century, a strange band of thousands of holes carved into a Peruvian hillside has defied explanation. Stretching for nearly a mile (1.5 km) along the edge of the Pisco Valley, Monte Sierpe – "serpent mountain" appears to be a deliberate, repetitive and almost mathematical feature – but its real purpose has so far eluded scientists.Continue ReadingCategory: Environment, ScienceTags: University of Sydney, Market, Agriculture, Mountain, Archeology, Farming, Mathematics

title: Ancient maths in modern physics: How Ramanujan’s 100-year-old pi formula connects to black hole theory
description: Ramanujan’s century-old pi formula is finding new relevance in modern physics, with scientists linking his mathematics to conformal field theories and black hole studies, revealing how ancient number theory is shaping today’s understanding of the universe.
